memory: The opponent's tendency to copy our last move can be exploited by probabilistically favoring our preferred outcome when the opponent cooperates.
The opponent's tendency to copy our last move can be better exploited by introducing probabilistic elements into our strategy.
The opponent's tendency to copy our last move can be further exploited by adjusting our strategy based on their last move, introducing a probabilistic element that favors our preferred outcome.
Incorporating probabilistic elements that favor our preferred outcome can effectively exploit the opponent's copying tendency, leading to improved scores.
Introducing a probabilistic switch to our preferred move can effectively exploit the opponent's copying tendency, leading to improved scores.
